endpoints.name: Add Item to Playback Queue

input_parameters.name: uri

input_parameters.name: device_id
input_parameters.description: The ID of the device to target. If not specified, the currently active device will be used. Example: '0d1841b0976bae2a3a310dd74c0f3df354899bc8'.

output_parameters.name: status_code
output_parameters.description: HTTP response status code indicating the result of the request.

output_parameters.name: response_message
output_parameters.description: Optional message associated with the response, such as error details.

endpoints.name: Get Several Tracks

output_parameters.name: tracks

endpoints.name: Check if User Follows Playlist

endpoints.name: Unfollow Artists or Users

output_parameters.name: status_code

endpoints.name: Search for Item

input_parameters.name: q
input_parameters.description: Your search query. You can refine the search with field filters like `album`, `artist`, `track`, `year`, `upc`, `tag:hipster`, `tag:new`, `isrc`, and `genre`. Filters apply to specific result types. For example: `q=remaster%20track:Doxy%20artist:Miles%20Davis`.

input_parameters.name: type
input_parameters.description: A comma-separated list of item types to search across. Allowed values: "album", "artist", "playlist", "track", "show", "episode", "audiobook".

input_parameters.name: market
input_parameters.description: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code to filter results to a specific market. If omitted, defaults to the user's country.

input_parameters.name: limit
input_parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. Default is 20. Range: 0-50.

input_parameters.name: offset
input_parameters.description: Index of the first result to return. Default is 0. Range: 0-1000.

input_parameters.name: include_external
input_parameters.description: If set to 'audio', includes externally hosted audio content in the results.

output_parameters.name: tracks
output_parameters.description: Object containing paginated list of search results for tracks, albums, artists, playlists, shows, episodes, or audiobooks based on the search.

endpoints.description: Endpoint to search for items in Spotify's catalog, matching a keyword string with optional filters.

endpoints.name: Get Playlist Cover Image

output_parameters.name: images
output_parameters.description: An array of image objects representing the playlist's cover images.

output_parameters.name: url

output_parameters.name: height
output_parameters.description: The height of the image in pixels. Nullable. Example: 300.

output_parameters.name: width
output_parameters.description: The width of the image in pixels. Nullable. Example: 300.

endpoints.name: Set Repeat Mode on User's Playback

input_parameters.name: state
input_parameters.description: The repeat mode. Must be one of: 'track', 'context', or 'off'. 'track' will repeat the current track, 'context' will repeat the current context, and 'off' will turn repeat off.

endpoints.description: Sets the repeat mode for the user's playback. Note: This API requires the 'user-modify-playback-state' scope. It only works for users with Spotify Premium. The order of execution is not guaranteed when used with other Player API endpoints.

endpoints.name: Get the User's Queue
endpoints.description: Retrieves the list of objects that make up the user's playback queue. This API requires the 'user-read-playback-state' scope. It only works for users with Spotify Premium. The response includes a 'currently_playing' object (which can be null) and a 'queue' array containing track or episode objects.

endpoints.name: Get Playlist

input_parameters.name: playlist_id
input_parameters.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist. Example: `3cEYpjA9oz9GiPac4AsH4n`

input_parameters.name: market
input_parameters.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. If specified, only content available in that market will be returned. If a user access token is provided, the user's country is used instead. Example: `ES`

input_parameters.name: fields
input_parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return. Supports nested fields with dot notation and parentheses, e.g., `tracks.items(added_at,added_by.id)`. Use '!' prefix to exclude fields, e.g., `tracks.items(track(name,href))`. Example: `items(added_by.id,track(name,href))`

input_parameters.name: additional_types
input_parameters.description: Comma-separated list of item types supporting besides 'track' and 'episode', e.g., `track,episode`. Note: this parameter might be deprecated.

output_parameters.name: collaborative
output_parameters.description: True if owners allow other users to modify the playlist.

output_parameters.name: description
output_parameters.description: The playlist description, nullable. Only returned for modified, verified playlists; otherwise null.

output_parameters.name: external_urls
output_parameters.description: Known external URLs for the playlist, e.g., Spotify URL.

output_parameters.name: href
output_parameters.description: Link to Web API endpoint providing full playlist details.

output_parameters.name: id
output_parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the playlist.

output_parameters.name: images
output_parameters.description: Array of image objects for the playlist, up to three images, sorted by size descending.

output_parameters.name: name
output_parameters.description: Name of the playlist.

output_parameters.name: owner
output_parameters.description: The owner of the playlist, including external URLs, href, id, type, uri, display name.

output_parameters.name: public
output_parameters.description: The playlist's public/private status; true if public, false if private, null if not relevant.

output_parameters.name: snapshot_id
output_parameters.description: Snapshot ID of the playlist for version control.

output_parameters.name: tracks
output_parameters.description: Object containing playlist tracks, including href, limit, next, offset, previous, total, and items array.

output_parameters.name: type
output_parameters.description: The object type: 'playlist'.

output_parameters.name: uri
output_parameters.description: The Spotify URI for the playlist.

endpoints.description: Get detailed information about a specific playlist by its ID.

input_parameters.name: position
input_parameters.description: The position to insert the items, zero-based index. Defaults to appending at the end if omitted. Example: `0`.

input_parameters.name: uris
input_parameters.description: Comma-separated list of Spotify URIs (track or episode) to add, e.g., `spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh`. Max 100 items. Note: for large sets, pass as JSON array in request body.

input_parameters.name: body
input_parameters.description: Request body supporting 'ids' as an array of strings of Spotify IDs, maximum 50, e.g., `{'ids': ['id1', 'id2']}`.

endpoints.name: Remove User's Saved Tracks

input_parameters.name: ids
input_parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the Spotify IDs for the tracks to remove. For example: '4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh,1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M'. Maximum: 50 IDs.

input_parameters.name: ids
input_parameters.description: An array of strings representing Spotify IDs. For example: ['7ouMYWpwJ422jRcDASZB7P', '4VqPOruhp5EdPBeR92t6lQ']. A maximum of 50 items can be specified in one request. If both 'ids' query parameter and this body property are present, the body property will be ignored.

endpoints.description: Removes one or more tracks from the current user's 'Your Music' library.

endpoints.name: Get Track's Audio Features

input_parameters.name: id
input_parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the track. Example: '11dFghVXANMlKmJXsNCbNl'.

output_parameters.name: acousticness
output_parameters.description: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic. 1.0 represents high confidence the track is acoustic.

output_parameters.name: analysis_url
output_parameters.description: A URL to access the full audio analysis of this track. An access token is required to access this data.

output_parameters.name: danceability
output_parameters.description: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0.

output_parameters.name: duration_ms
output_parameters.description: The duration of the track in milliseconds.

output_parameters.name: energy
output_parameters.description: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of perceptual measure of intensity and activity.

output_parameters.name: id
output_parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the track.

output_parameters.name: instrumentalness
output_parameters.description: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals, with values closer to 1.0 indicating a higher likelihood of being purely instrumental.

output_parameters.name: key
output_parameters.description: The key the track is in, represented as an integer from -1 to 11, following the Pitch Class notation.

output_parameters.name: liveness
output_parameters.description: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording, with higher values indicating a higher probability that the track was performed live.

output_parameters.name: loudness
output_parameters.description: The overall loudness of the track in decibels (dB). Usually between -60 and 0.

output_parameters.name: mode
output_parameters.description: The modality (major or minor) of the track, 1 for major, 0 for minor.

output_parameters.name: speechiness
output_parameters.description: Detects the presence of spoken words in a track, with values above 0.66 indicating likely speech content.

output_parameters.name: tempo
output_parameters.description: The estimated tempo of the track in beats per minute (BPM).

output_parameters.name: time_signature
output_parameters.description: An estimated time signature, range from 3 to 7.

output_parameters.name: track_href
output_parameters.description: A URL to access full details of the track via the Web API.

output_parameters.name: type
output_parameters.description: The object type, always 'audio_features'.

output_parameters.name: uri
output_parameters.description: The Spotify URI for the track.

output_parameters.name: valence
output_parameters.description: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 representing the musical positiveness conveyed by the track.

endpoints.description: Get audio feature information for a single track identified by its Spotify ID.

endpoints.name: Get User's Top Items

input_parameters.name: type
input_parameters.description: The type of item to return. Valid values: 'artists' or 'tracks'.

input_parameters.name: time_range
input_parameters.description: Over what time period the affinities are computed. Valid values: 'long_term', 'medium_term', 'short_term'. Default: 'medium_term'.

input_parameters.name: limit
input_parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return. Default: 20, min: 1, max: 50.

input_parameters.name: offset
input_parameters.description: The index of the first item to return. Default: 0.

output_parameters.name: href
output_parameters.description: A link to the API endpoint returning the full result of the request.

output_parameters.name: limit
output_parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned.

output_parameters.name: next
output_parameters.description: URL to the next page of items, or null.

output_parameters.name: offset
output_parameters.description: The offset of the items returned.

output_parameters.name: previous
output_parameters.description: URL to the previous page of items, or null.

output_parameters.name: total
output_parameters.description: The total number of items available.

output_parameters.name: items
output_parameters.description: An array of artist or track objects, each with their own detailed schema.

endpoints.description: Get the current user's top artists or tracks based on affinity over a specified time frame.

output_parameters.name: album.name

output_parameters.name: album.release_date

endpoints.name: Get Playlist Items

input_parameters.name: playlist_id
input_parameters.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist. This is a unique identifier for the playlist, e.g., '3cEYpjA9oz9GiPac4AsH4n'.

input_parameters.name: market
input_parameters.description: A Spotify country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2). If specified, only content available in that market will be returned. Example: 'ES'.

input_parameters.name: fields
input_parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the fields to include in the response. Supports nested object fields using parentheses. Example: 'items(added_at,track(name,href,album(name,href)))'.

input_parameters.name: limit
input_parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return. Default is 20. Range: 1-50. Example: 10.

input_parameters.name: offset
input_parameters.description: The index of the first item to return. Default is 0. Example: 5.

input_parameters.name: additional_types
input_parameters.description: A comma-separated list of item types supported besides 'track'. Valid types include 'track' and 'episode'. Used to support multiple content types.

output_parameters.name: href
output_parameters.description: Link to the Web API endpoint returning the full result of the request.

output_parameters.name: limit
output_parameters.description: Maximum number of items in the response.

output_parameters.name: next
output_parameters.description: URL to the next page of items. Null if there is no next page.

output_parameters.name: offset
output_parameters.description: The offset of the items returned.

output_parameters.name: previous
output_parameters.description: URL to the previous page of items. Null if there is no previous page.

output_parameters.name: total
output_parameters.description: Total number of items available.

output_parameters.name: items
output_parameters.description: Array of playlist track objects.

general_info.explanation: OAuth 2.0 access token with appropriate scopes to authorize API calls. Used for authenticated requests.
Your Spotify application's client ID, used for authentication during authorization flows.
Your Spotify application's client secret, used for authentication during authorization flows.
The URL to redirect to after authentication, must match the one set in your Spotify app settings.
Optional ISO country code filter for content availability and market-specific data.
Maximum number of items to return; default is 20, range typically from 1 to 50.
Index of the first result to return, used for pagination.
The Spotify ID of a playlist to retrieve or modify, consistent across endpoints.
Comma-separated list of Spotify IDs used for bulk operations like checking presence or removing items.
The name of a playlist or item, used when creating or renaming.
Boolean string indicating if the playlist is public ('true') or private ('false').
Boolean string to set playlist as collaborative or not.
ID of the device targeted for playback commands.
Boolean indicator ('true'/'false') to start playback on the specified device.
Spotify ID of the resource, such as an artist, album, show, or episode.
Locale string for localization purposes, such as language codes.
